provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. (i) Precedence will be as per Queen's Regulations but an Adult
       Under Officer shall rank immediately above a Warrant
        Officer.
   (5) Seniority in any rank will be according to the date of
       substantive promotion.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6. OfEcer ranks will be as follows-
             (i) AC~ING    rank authorized by the Commandant.
                The Commandant may, by publication in Force
                 Orders, grant the Acting rank of Second-Lieutenant
                 to a member of the Cadet Force for a period of up
                 to twelve months for the purpose of taking an
                 Officers Course.
            (ii) TEMPORARY    rank authorized by the Commandant.
                 The Commandant may. by publication in Force
                 Orders, for a specific or temporary duty make tem-
                porary appointments and grant temporary rank up
                 to and including the rank of Major to any Com-
                 missioned Officer, and may at any time in like
                manner revoke such appointment or rank.
            (iii) SUBSTANT~VE
                           rank authorized by the Governor-
                  General.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. (i) The Commandant may, by publication in Force Orders-
                      (a) appoint a member of the Cadet Force to
                            the rank of Adult Under Officer and may
            me hdlusion of this page io authorized by L.N. 4119761
        T H E JAMAICA COMBINED CADET FORCE RULES. 1971
                            in like manner revoke any such appointment.
                             On appointment such person shall become
                            a member of the Officers' Mess;
                        (b) appoint, on the recommendation of the
                            Officer Commanding a Cadet Unit or Train-
                            ing Corps, a member of such Cadet Unit
                            or Training Corps, to the rank of Company
                            Sergeant-Major, Adult Company Sergeant-
                            Major or Quartermaster-Sergeant and in like
                            manner revoke any such appointment.
      (ii) The Officer Commanding a Cadet Unit or Training Corps
           may appoint a member of his unit or corps to the rank
           of Sergeant or Acting Sergeant or other lower rank. Any
           such appointment which does not conform with the authorized
           establishment of the unit or corps shall be invalid.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. (i) No member will be appointed to the substantive rank of
         Sergeant or to a higher rank until he has passed the Force
         Proficiency examination.
      (ii) The Commandant may, however, waive the Force Proficiency
           examination in cases where a Commission is being granted
           to someone who is to serve the Force in a technical or
           professional capacity.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. Every applicant for a commission in the Cadet Force will make
his application on such Form as shall be approved by the Commandant
on the recommendation of the Jamaica Cadet Committee.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. An Officer who has decided to terminate his service shall make
application in writing to the Commandant stating his reasons. An Officer
may be called upon, on the recommendation of the Commandant, to
retire or resign his Commission for misconduct or other good and suffici-
ent reason and in the event of his failing to do so his Commission may be
terminated.

provisions.title: Section 11
provisions.content:
11. A person who desires to join a Cadet Unit or a Training Corps
must make application to the O&er Commanding the Cadet Unit or
Training Corps concerned.
   12 No person may be enrolled as a member of a Cadet Unit who has
not attained the age of fourteen years; exczpt that where there is an
insufficient number of persons of that age available to maintain the

strength of the Cadet Unit up to its full establishment the Officer
Commanding the unit may permit a number of persons of the age
of thirteen and a half years or more to join the unit up to one-
fifth of its establishment.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. On acceptance every member must provide himself with a copy
of the Cadet Force Handbook.

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14. Any other rank who desires to terminate his services, other than
on leaving his school or institution, will make an application in writing
to his Officer Commanding stating his reasons.

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15. Where the Ofticer Commanding a Cadet Unit or Training Corps
considers that by reason of general incapacity, or unfitness, or for any
cause which he deems sufficient, a member of the unit or corps should
not continue in his appointment, the Officer Commanding may invite
him to tender his resignation.
  A resignation tendered in these circumstances need not show the
member's reasons for tendering his resignation, but it will be accom-
panied by a report from the Officer Commanding to the Commandant.

provisions.title: Section 16
provisions.content:
16. The Commandant may determine the service of or suspend any
Other Rank if such Other Rank does not perfom the duties he under-
takes or fm any reason.

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17. Every member upon leaving the Cadet Force is entitled to a
Certificate of Service.

provisions.title: Section 18
provisions.content:
18. Every Officer Commanding will forward to Headquarters Jamaica
Combined Cadet Force the names of Cadets leaving his unit and will
request the issue of Certificates of Service.

provisions.title: Section 19
provisions.content:
19. The dress of members of the Cadet Force will be as decided
from time to time by the Jamaica Cadet Committee and published in
Force Orders.

provisions.title: Section 20
provisions.content:
20. Badges of Rank as obtaining in the Jamaica Defence Force (Army
Section) will be worn by the personnel listed in rule 4.

provisions.title: Section 21
provisions.content:
21. Unit flashes and proficiency badges as authorized from time to
time by the Commandant will be worn.
  2 2 Cadet dress. badges, insignia or flashes will only be worn by
members of the Cadet Force on Cadet Force duties or when specially
autharized by the Commandant or Commanding Officer.

provisions.title: Section 23
provisions.content:
23. The Jamaica Cadet Committee may recommend to the Governor-
G e n d a suitable person to hold the appointment of Honorary Colonel
of the Jamaica Combined Cadet Force.
